column4: I have a folder full of files with a space right before the file extention and I'd like to run a one line command to get rid of the space   foo bar .txt     I want to space between bar and .txt removed
man rename
I am running xbmc-live i only have access to this box via SSH command line
that is all you need for rename
I had  (USA) in the file name earlier today and some one helped me out to remove (USA) but this left me with a space  and now I need the space removed
can I just   sudo apt-get install man rename      ??????????
you should already have it installed
try - /your/path/to/the/files:$ rename "s/ *//g" *.txt
I don't have rename installed I have tried it already
aptitude install rename, then.
that line didn't remove my space :(
one sec.
it worked here
http://pastebin.com/HN3Z8WY2
ok after running the command  it drops me down to the next line  with a >
control+C
use the second one.
the files are *.zip so I changed your .txt to  .zip
txt was just for testing. ;]
rename "s/ *//g" *.zip     ---> the line should be like this
you Da Man
anyway to remove  foo bar (stuffhere).zip   so it ends up --> foo bar.zip
anyway to remove  foo bar (stuffhere).zip   so it ends up --> foo bar.zip
